intro: Chomelia bahiae, commonly known as the Bahamian chomelia, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and range in color from white to pale yellow. Chomelia bahiae is adapted to coastal and sandy soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
